titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Charles Moore, Indictment
CWG5475

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Green Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
vs } Indictment
Charles Moor

The Grand Jury of Green County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse Charles Moor of the Offence of forcibly preventing a qualified ^voter^ from giving his vote. Committed as follows to Wit the Said Charles Moore on the day of August 1865 in the County aforesaid did unlawfully knowingly and forciblely by himself and did aid of others prevent and attempt to prevent William Harlow from giving his vote by arresting aiding in the arrest of said Harlow and forciblely taking him from the poles which said Harlow was then & there a legal & qualified Voter and attempted to vote at a legal Election which was then & there being held under the Constitution at the legal voting place in Election precint No in Green County known as the Brewersburg precint for the purpose of Electing members of Congress of the United States and the State Legislature And said Moor then and there knowingly Said Harlow to be a qualified Voter in Said precint forciblely and unlawfully prevented and aided others in preventing said Harlow from giving his vote

Against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky
J. H. C Sandidge
Atty for Commonwealth
A True Bill
Wm S. Buckner Foreman"
Witnesses Examined
Wm Harlow, Daniel Turner & Abner Gooch
Filed day of November 1863-
S. T. Wilson clk

A Copy Attest
S. T. Wilson clerk
Green Circuit Court
Green Cir Ct
Commonwealth
vs } Copy Indictment
Chas. Moore
Indicted Nov term for preventing a qualified voter from giving his vote.
